definition: sb with whom one is on familiar terms/sb from the same place (same house, same town etc)/one of us

home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: He did not mention it even in the bosom of his family.
sentences.chinese: 他甚至在自家人中也未提及此事。

sentences.english: Contact so long, he know quick son to take good care of people of the same group.
sentences.chinese: 接觸了這麼久，他是知道敏兒對自家人的愛護的。

sentences.english: The third time you share a cup of tea, you become family.
sentences.chinese: 第三次喝的時候，你就成了自家人。

sentences.english: One relative defamed Tom by claiming that he stole money from his own family.
sentences.chinese: 一個親戚中傷湯姆說他曾偷自家人的錢。

sentences.english: She always considers us as the members of her family.
sentences.chinese: 她總把我們當做自家人。

sentences.english: Some friends are just like family.
sentences.chinese: 一些朋友就像自家人一樣。

sentences.english: One relative defamed Linda by claiming these he stole cash since his have apatmenthold.
sentences.chinese: 一個親戚誹謗湯姆說他曾偷自家人的錢。

sentences.english: They considered me as a member of their family.
They all look on him as a member of their family.
sentences.chinese: 他們都把他看作是自家人。

sentences.english: I should help my brother to pay all his debts. After all he is my own flesh and blood.
sentences.chinese: 我想我應該幫我的弟弟還錢，畢竟我們是自家人。

sentences.english: They looked upon us as belonging to the family.
sentences.chinese: 他們把我們作自家人看待。

definition: those on our side/ourselves/one's own people/one of us
parents of one's daughter-in-law or son-in-law/relatives by marriage
to regard sb as an outsider
words of politeness/politesse/decorous talking/talk with propriety
erhua variant of 兒媳婦|儿媳妇[er2 xi2 fu5]
(neologism 2015) the Zhao family (derogatory term for those who hold power in the PRC)
